Events that occurred on 10 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1950 - J.R.R. Tolkien returns from a stay at his son's cottage where he made some final revisions to The Lord of the Rings (see Letter 134).
1950 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 129.
1951 - First day of the Congrès Internationale de Philologie Moderne at the University of Liège, a conference in which J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the paper "Middle English 'Losenger'".
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien wins the International Fantasy Award.
1959 - Actor Jim Meskimen is born.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 263.
2007 - "from mind to mind": Robert Browning and J.R.R. Tolkien is published.
2010 - Bulgarian Tolkien Society's 6th Tolkien-Fest in Sofia.
2010 - The Lord of the Rings Online goes free-to-play for the general public in North America.
2015 - Oxonmoot 2015 at St Antony's College.
2016 - Oxonmoot 2016 at St Antony's College.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
